title: Making America Beautiful Again by Improving Our National Parks

enrichment.summary: This executive order aims to improve and preserve America's national parks by increasing entrance fees for foreign tourists while making access more affordable for U.S. residents. It directs federal officials to invest increased fee revenues into park infrastructure and services, promote international tourism, and review existing rules to reduce unnecessary restrictions on park recreation.
potential_concerns: Raising fees for foreign tourists could reduce international visitation and negatively impact local economies that depend on tourism.
Preferential treatment for U.S. residents may raise legal or diplomatic concerns about fairness and international reciprocity.
Review and potential rescinding of recreational access rules enacted during the prior administration may lead to disputes or uncertainty for park visitors and operators.
Increased entrance fees might create barriers for certain international visitors, affecting diversity and global engagement with national parks.
Implementation challenges include balancing fee increases against visitor experience and ensuring sufficient funding is allocated effectively to park improvements.
